column3: It's not about failure; it's about trying something and risking something for attaining your goal.
The man who is intent on making the most of his opportunities is too busy to bother about luck.

A life lesson for me is, how do you muster the courage to take on a new risk? Whether it's starting up a business or taking on a new project or expedition. I think the risks that we take are all relative to the risk-taker.
But we also believe in taking risks, because that's how you move things along.
This business is always changing. If you're going to be a leader, you've got to take chances.
I just have to take my chances like any other composer.
If you know you can do it - if you can already chart every day in your future - then why bother? Choose to do something you have more trouble imagining. Take a chance.

Each of us has about 40 chances to accomplish our goals in life. I learned this first through agriculture, because all farmers can expect to have about 40 growing seasons, giving them just 40 chances to improve on every harvest.
It's not that I don't value my life. It's just that I love taking chances, testing myself, stepping over the line.
It comes from the likes of you! Take what you can get! Grab the chances as they come along! Act in hallways! Sing in doorways! Dance in cellars!

The best thing to do is stare it in the face and move on. We have to face our fears and plow through. I think taking chances takes a lot more courage than staying stagnant and doing what's safe and comfortable.
